website_summaries.verdict: The Fluke LinkSprinter 200 lets you identify issues with Internet connectivity, DHCP, switch ports, and gateways without having to lug around a laptop for testing. It's our Editors' Choice for network troubleshooting tools.
pros: Thorough tests, easy to read results
Connects to smartphone or tablet to view test results if there is no network
cons: Displays only the first DNS server

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and durable Network Tester
customer_reviews.text: Very handy device for checking link status on ports. I can see results immediately on my iPhone, which I like. This function does require that I connect to the LinkSprinter device, which only takes a few seconds. In my situation this device gives me all the information I need, which is: Link, PoE, Gateway, DHCP, Switch. The LED lights on the device quickly tells you the areas of concern. The reason I did not give this device a 5 star rating is due to its cost.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Connell

customer_reviews.title: The 300 series is much better. It gives you cable length and that helps ...
customer_reviews.text: The 300 series is much better. It gives you cable length and that helps without having to do other things when determining issues with cable distance. I can capture screen shots and email them to my help desk while out in the field. i cam prove test results without debate. That saves time and switch port information saves times. I'm more then happy with the device. I will suggest flipping one of batteries when the device is in your tech Bag. Helps ensure its not on accidentally while stored in your bag. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine

customer_reviews.title: This made that so easy. I exported out all the test for there ...
customer_reviews.text: I just wired a gym that had 24 drops. This came in handy. The customer wanted a print out that all the drops tested. This made that so easy. I exported out all the test for there 24 drops and printed out the test. It also was nice that it showed what port on the switch the drop was plugged into. Nice little peace of hardware for the tool box.
customer_reviews.author: minitrucker007

customer_reviews.title: Work in IT?  You *NEED* this item.
customer_reviews.text: While I love this product, I'm extremely upset. Until this came out, I was going to invent a device that would have done exactly what this does and was going to put it on Kickstarter. But of course I'm too lazy and have too much work to do at home and the office and so I never got around to it. But kudos to Fluke for reading my mind!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Spring

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: These Link Sprinters are handy for testing and identifying network cable conditions. They identify switch and port location. Very Handy.
customer_reviews.author: Juke Box

customer_reviews.title: Wow.. Just Wow. This thing Documents everything ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow.. Just Wow. This thing Documents everything online and fires it to an email address for you as well. Has already helped me track down problems and document ports for an entire wing of the school I work for.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Yockim

customer_reviews.title: This is a MUST HAVE tool for any tech. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a MUST HAVE tool for any tech. It will pay for itself many, many times overs. Fluke has a major winner with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar A. Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: You really can't live without one of these in your ...
customer_reviews.text: You really can't live without one of these in your networking bag, makes locating a cable on a switch as simple as plugging this in
customer_reviews.author: Jason Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Get one - NOW!
customer_reviews.text: This is an AWESOME add on to the tool kit - makes FAST work out of gathering data and troubleshooting network problems!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S Judd

customer_reviews.title: great device
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for a quick high level analysis of a network patch port. I recommend the LinkSprinter to anyone who needs to see DHCP, POE, Vlan config and switch port outlet number etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Fluke Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little tester. Great for doing quick checks on new RJ45 Ethernet drops to quickly determine if they are ready to go. Huge time saver! Email feature is a great tool to document all the details and help you remember what you saw.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: that would have been perfect. But I am still very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. If only it had a wire map option... that would have been perfect. But I am still very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Flavius

customer_reviews.title: good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: as a Network admin by day and consultant by night, this device is invaluable for troubleshooting basic and advanced networking issues. Within seconds you know what going on with Layers 1 and 2. Whip out your smart phone and you know get to see whats going on in layer 3. So small, you might forget about it in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Klems

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool highly recommend it to network admins
customer_reviews.text: Have already found this super useful in the few weeks I have had it. Also has built in web server to help diagnose issues
customer_reviews.author: Mike Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool for tracking down network ports and switches from the far end.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS FINCH

customer_reviews.title: A "gotta have" for any technician.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. It provides all of the network info I need without all the bells and whistles of the high end testers.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Skulnik

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great price
customer_reviews.text: I had been needing a tool like this for a while, but everything I found was $1k+. This is the perfect product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! A must have for all IT Specialists or Network Administrators. This a powerful tool that gives you 10-15 minutes worth of troubleshooting information in about 10 seconds. I was the first one at my company to get one and now everyone in my department wants one!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: I am so tired of customers telling me their network is fine.
customer_reviews.text: I plug this in and just point to the results. No more arguing etc. Fluke once again has your back.
customer_reviews.author: Claves

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I saw this tester advertised and knew I had to have it right away. It's value is in it's ability to quickly determine at what level the problem exists, from DHCP to internal routing to outside connection. The fact that it gives you the LLDP information and tells you the switch and port that it's connected to saves a ton of time when you have a large network like mine that is not always well labeled.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Innes

customer_reviews.title: Extremely expensive device that does only basic work.
customer_reviews.text: This device is too basic to justify the price for it. Connecting to the Internet and checking POE is hardly worth the $300.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mabrey

customer_reviews.title: Almost too good!
customer_reviews.text: I wired up my entire house, and this made it so much easier to make sure I had all the wiring done properly with full internet access in every room. It gave me more information than I knew I needed! Dead simple to use, plug in and wait for all the icons to glow green... if there is a problem, simply sync it with your android/iOS device... if one check fails, you know exactly what the problem is, rather than spending hours troubleshooting. Highly recommend this to any semi-professional, or those doing a large home/office installation (or ongoing maintenance of a large network)!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M. Folts

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy Network Troubleshooting
customer_reviews.text: I remember many years ago, I had a network tester that featured 4 lights, and that was it. This Fluke Networks network tester is a far cry from that ancient tester. The features, although seemingly basic to new IT people, are a dream for us old school guys. I have found this tool to save me a lot of time when troubleshooting network drops, connection issues, and even helping speed up installations during the final testing phase. It is a decent price for what it does, and while it may not be necessary for the Do It Yourself-er, the professional IT person will find it pays for itself with the time it save you.
customer_reviews.author: RicoTX

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely recommend this product. I bought the 300 model (locally) for the short, open, split and fault functions and that works wonderfully. I made different patch cables to test different situations such as RJ45 to RJ11 male and female. It all works flawlessly. Next I'll make a RJ45 to alligator clips. My only gripe is that the WiFi is weak on the device.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Herrera

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a deal and I am so glad I did great little tool to see if a network jack is active and working. One thing I would of like to see different that I think they can do much better. For you to view this on a iPhone you need to go to a IP which means you need to disconnect from the network and go to the one the link runner creates and punch in some random IP I can never remember. Think Bluetooth how hard is that or an app it would just make it so much easer and faster than reconfiguring your network device.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Sweet SMALL tester for a great price - ties in with email, cloud and Smartphone!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a sweet tester at the price - it provides quick, easy-to-read, easy-to understand results, and links quickly and easily to your cloud, Smartphone or email to sync up the actual test results. The size of this device is actually a bonus - it pretty much fits in your pocket! It's small size, robust-ness and useability make this little network tester a great addition to any IT engineer's arsenal. Fluke creates another great device with this network tester, would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: randomartco

customer_reviews.title: excellent tester, gives very useful information like negotiated speed
customer_reviews.text: excellent tester, gives very useful information like negotiated speed, whether dns handed out an address, ping times to google, the configured vlan and much more. conveniently access the info from a mobile device or via the website
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S Henning

customer_reviews.title: Quality network tester in a small package
customer_reviews.text: This tester really is overkill for what I need, but the small size is great and now I can troubleshoot the network when I have issue in my network -- and away from home. Please note: this tester comes with access to the Linksprinter Cloud service for 120 days for free, but you have to pay for the service after that.
customer_reviews.author: BumbleB

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to use. Plug and play mentality. (Mobile device required) Faster than older Fluke network testers i have used. Browser interface. Cons: Expensive. A bit of trouble to initially setup. I would recommend this product but I think it is a bit expensive foe what is offers. Like others have stated most of the operations that it can do can be done by software and a laptop. This is very mobile over a bulky laptop and at a lower price might it's a no brainier.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Quick Debugging
customer_reviews.text: This little tester is a perfect little device to hand out to field techs and local support people. Pretty much plug and play. Diagnose and test PoE, Link, DHCP, Gateway and Cloud connectivity. View the results on your tablet or cell phone. Super slick.
customer_reviews.author: @TrevorHikes

customer_reviews.title: I like it. It's a modern upgrade from my old Fluke Tester
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade from the LinkSprinter 100. Really like the Wi-Fi Access Point feature. The unit itself is very streamlined and you will need to have a smartphone or tablet to take full advantage of the features. Solid feel, durable. Nice compact size. Easy to setup. Great Fluke quality. I think this is a sold 5 stars easy.
customer_reviews.author: Earth Spirits

customer_reviews.title: Very useful compact tool.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to test numerous drops on a large network deployment this week. Very compact and easy to carry in your pocket with all the basic information you need right on the lights. If you are looking for more information, you have multiple options. You can connect your cell phone to it's built in wireless hot spot, and your cell phone will act as the display. With the cloud capability, you can get your results emailed to you, and they can also be stored in your personal LinkSprinter cloud. I found these features very valuable this week. Highly recommend this tool to anyone who needs quick port information without all the bulk and expense of a higher end tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: We use this little guy to verify our network connections, and it allows us to document what port on the switch is connected to which end point. The web interface is well done. Not overly complicated, but with the information that you need. Support is great as well, with them pushing out patches in response to feedback quite quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Pheylan

customer_reviews.title: Simple to setup and use!
customer_reviews.text: Once I received this product and registered it easily online I was able to plug it right into my home network to get the latest firmware update and then linked it to my iPhone using Google Chrome browser. The interface is easy to use and i like having the ability to modify the test on the fly from the phone. Additionally, being able to added comments to the test reports so that they appear online is a great add. The general concept of using a smartphone or tablet to control the unit is a great way to introduce a powerful tool at a low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wright

customer_reviews.title: This is, by far, the most feature rich and robust network tester I've used...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this multiple times within my office when trying to determine problems with network connectivity. The results I've received from the device have quickly helped me to determine what to do next - without having to leave the testing area to look at the results. The icons on the interface tell me the basics - but I've got multiple methods to access the actual results of the test (cloud, email, smartphone). Build quality of the device is good. (I've dropped it more than once, and I keep on testing...)
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Ethernet Tester
customer_reviews.text: Needed to test drops for a large deployment and this did the trick for quick mobile testing. I like the size and if you need more information the web reporting is very detailed. This unit tests Link, POE, DHCP, Gateway and Cloud (WWW).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Complaints
customer_reviews.text: Lots of features for such a small gadget. Efficient. Easy to navigate. Highly recommended. You won't be disappointed. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great little Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a godsend if you use managed switches. Plug it in and it reports the switch name and port number. Much faster than toning. Of course, you'll still need to tone cables that are not plugged into anything.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Great Network Tester
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very easy to use and comes in handy when the wall jack is not labeled, or you have too many cables on the punch down to trace one cable. The web interface is easy to read and allows you to see if the jack is POE, what port on what switch its connected to and if it can get out to the internet. A few things that it lacks are the ability to test where the line is broken if there is not full connectivity, how long the run is, and the ability to see where it is located on the main switch if running through a basic 5 port switch at the workstation. Otherwise, great tool!
customer_reviews.author: TODD G

customer_reviews.title: Great IT Tool
customer_reviews.text: Before owning a LinkSprinter I would have to crack open my laptop to perform even the most basic networking troubleshooting. Not anymore, with this little guy I can do all of it from an interface on my phone (no app required), so now it takes me seconds to figure out where the connectivity issues are and I don't have to lug around the laptop to every Ethernet port. Thank you Fluke Networks!
customer_reviews.author: G T

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool to quickly gather data
customer_reviews.text: You will like this tool if you are mapping out ports or troubleshooting a pesky port. You get reports through the cloud interface that will tell you all kinds of information. Like IP, Vlan, switch port, etc. We like the Wifi option as it gives us some flexibility with the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: Allows us to easily assess network health no matter what the qualifications of person we have on-site! And the pricing means that we can afford to have several so one is always available when something comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R Harrison

customer_reviews.title: I liked the small size my techs could carry it in ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit because I thought I would get more detailed information when it was connected to a tablet or a laptop for transmission of network data and use the basic testing as a stand alone unit for quick results. I liked the small size my techs could carry it in their pocket.. The better solution is to buy an adapter for your tablet that you can connect a network cable to and then run any number of free apps which can give you far more information. The adapter costs about $12.00. This is a waste of money $299.00 you can buy a tablet and adapter and get far more info.
customer_reviews.author: Truenight

customer_reviews.title: *Way* too expensive for what it is...
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat idea, but the price point they should have hit is $45. For $50, I can get a computer on a chip with an ethernet port and do all these tests (with LEDS!! \o/) and much more. I could even stick a speedtest in there (*gasp*) or whatever I want. Why is this $300??
customer_reviews.author: Paul Miller

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: waste of money and complete garbage. Don't be fooled by the 5 stars. Most fluke products are all garbage with the exception of their multimeters. Stick to multimeters Fluke. You want a good cable tester go check out the Cable Prowler. works best
customer_reviews.author: blade reaper

product_meta.title: Fluke Networks LinkSprinter 200 Network Tester with WiFi
product_meta.description: this Smart Network Tester Fits In Your Pocket, Connects To Your Phone And Stores Your Network Test Results In The Cloud.five Essential Network Tests In The Palm Of Your Handpower Over Ethernet (poe) Check To Make Sure You Can Power A Phone, Security Camera Or Access Point Through A Specific Port. The Linksprinter Network Tester Can Even Run Without Batteries On Poe.link To The Switch Perform A Switch Test, Which Will Indicate The Switch Name And Port Your Cable Connects To. Know Your Available Speed And Duplex Settings.dhcp Connection Confirm That The Dhcp Server Is Running And Responsive. Request An Ip Address, Get Your Subnet Information, And Identify The Default Gateway And Dns Server.gateway Connection Verify The Gateway/router Address And Reachability By Pinging The Device Three Times.internet Connection Confirm Cloud Connectivity Or Internal Service Reachability. Verify Dns Server Lookup And Application Port Connectivity.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
